meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be destroyed or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The destructibilities of the fragile vase made it easy to break.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the destructibilities of different materials in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The destructibilities of the paper airplane were put to the test when it flew into a fan.
meanings.sent4: The destructibilities of trust can shatter as easily as glass.
meanings.sent5: The destructibilities of the sandcastle were evident as the waves washed it away.

meanings.definition: The state of being prone to destruction or harm.
meanings.sent1: The old building's destructibilities were evident in its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent2: Living in a war zone increases one's exposure to destructibilities.
meanings.sent3: The destructibilities of the cookie jar were tested by the mischievous toddler.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, our destructibilities can either break us or make us stronger.
meanings.sent5: The destructibilities of the ancient artifact made it a risky item to transport.
